title: Kattens Værn
card_descrip: This project was created with my exam group in collaboration with Kattens Værn. We redesigned and built a new brand identity and website to inspire and relate better to the younger part of their target group.
detail_descrip_1: This website was created with three other students for our final Multimedia design exam where I was mainly responsible for the development.  We were lucky to be able to work together with Kattens Værn to give them our take on a redesigned new website that would better relate to the younger part of their target group.
detail_descrip_2: We built a modern frontend to display and manage all their data using Next.js, and set up a WordPress site to serve as their content management system. Most of the content is dynamic and fetched from WordPress, including the list of adoptable cats, articles, and shelter locations — all of which can be created, edited, or removed through the WordPress backend. The “missing” and “found” cat forms also post to WordPress and trigger a build hook, ensuring the updated content appears on the site shortly after. This setup was necessary because much of the site uses statically generated pages to improve SEO and increase visibility in search engines.
